term.title: photorearrangement

item.text: Photoisomerization involving changes in the arrangement of the atoms within the molecular species. It may lead to unstable isomers that react further by, e.g., dehydrogenation, deprotonation, or other reactions.

notes.item: Examples are photorearrangements of alkenes (other than cis-trans photoisomerization), of cyclohex-2-enones, of endoperoxides, of thioarenes, the di-π-methane rearrangement and others.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 398 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
